title: 1 Timothy Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 1 Timothy with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 6 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the letter to Timothy?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as the author in 1 Timothy 1:1.

questions.question: To whom is the letter of 1 Timothy addressed?
questions.explanation: Paul calls Timothy his own son in the faith in 1 Timothy 1:2.

questions.question: What was Timothy instructed to do in Ephesus according to 1 Timothy 1?
options: Charge some that they teach no other doctrine
questions.correctAnswer: Charge some that they teach no other doctrine
questions.explanation: Paul instructs Timothy to charge certain people not to teach other doctrines in 1 Timothy 1:3.

questions.question: According to 1 Timothy 1:5, what is the end of the commandment?
options: Charity out of a pure heart
questions.correctAnswer: Charity out of a pure heart
questions.explanation: The commandment's end is charity out of a pure heart, good conscience, and faith unfeigned.

questions.question: Paul describes his former life before salvation in 1 Timothy 1. Which of these was NOT one of the ways he describes himself?
questions.explanation: Paul mentions blasphemer, persecutor, and injurious but not thief in 1 Timothy 1:13.

questions.question: What is the 'faithful saying' mentioned in 1 Timothy 1:15?
options: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners
Love covers a multitude of sins
questions.correctAnswer: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners
questions.explanation: Paul states that this saying is worthy of all acceptation in 1 Timothy 1:15.

questions.question: According to 1 Timothy 2:1, what should be made for all men?
options: Supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks
questions.correctAnswer: Supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts that these be made for all men in 1 Timothy 2:1.

questions.question: For whom does Paul specifically say to pray in 1 Timothy 2:2?
options: Kings and all that are in authority
questions.correctAnswer: Kings and all that are in authority
questions.explanation: Prayers are to be made for those in authority that we may live peaceably.

questions.question: According to 1 Timothy 2:5, who is the one mediator between God and men?
questions.explanation: There is one God and one mediator, the man Christ Jesus.

questions.question: In 1 Timothy 2:9, how should women adorn themselves?
options: In modest apparel with shamefacedness and sobriety
questions.correctAnswer: In modest apparel with shamefacedness and sobriety
questions.explanation: Paul instructs women to wear modest apparel, not costly adornments.

questions.question: What does Paul say about women teaching or usurping authority over men in 1 Timothy 2:12?
options: He allows it in certain cases
questions.explanation: Paul says he does not permit a woman to teach or have authority over a man.

questions.question: According to 1 Timothy 3:1, what is true about a man who desires the office of a bishop?
questions.explanation: The desire for the office of bishop is described as a good work.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a qualification for a bishop according to 1 Timothy 3:2-3?
questions.explanation: A bishop must not be given to wine; it is a disqualifying trait.

questions.question: What is the qualification for deacons mentioned in 1 Timothy 3:8?
options: Grave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre
questions.correctAnswer: Grave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre
questions.explanation: These are the specific qualities required of deacons.

questions.question: What mystery is described as 'great' in 1 Timothy 3:16?
questions.explanation: Paul calls the mystery of godliness great in this verse.

questions.question: According to 1 Timothy 4:1, what will happen in the latter times?
options: Some shall depart from the faith
questions.correctAnswer: Some shall depart from the faith
questions.explanation: The Spirit says some will depart from the faith and follow seducing spirits.

questions.question: What is forbidden by some according to 1 Timothy 4:3?
questions.explanation: Some forbid marriage and command abstinence from meats.

questions.question: What does Paul say is profitable unto all things in 1 Timothy 4:8?
questions.explanation: Godliness has promise of this life and that to come; bodily exercise profits little.

questions.question: In 1 Timothy 4:12, what is Timothy instructed to be an example in?
options: Word, conversation, charity, spirit, faith, purity
questions.correctAnswer: Word, conversation, charity, spirit, faith, purity
questions.explanation: Timothy is told to be an example in these areas despite his youth.

questions.question: According to 1 Timothy 5:8, what does a man do if he provides not for his own household?
options: He is worse than an infidel
questions.correctAnswer: He is worse than an infidel
questions.explanation: Paul says caring for one's family is essential and not doing so is worse than being an unbeliever.

questions.question: Who does Paul instruct Timothy to rebuke sharply in 1 Timothy 5:20?
questions.explanation: Elders who sin should be rebuked publicly to deter others.

questions.question: According to 1 Timothy 6:6, what is great gain?
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that godliness combined with contentment is great gain.

questions.question: What does Paul say is the root of all evil in 1 Timothy 6:10?
questions.explanation: The love of money leads to many sorrows and errors from the faith.

questions.question: What charge does Paul give Timothy in 1 Timothy 6:12?
options: Fight the good fight of faith
questions.correctAnswer: Fight the good fight of faith
questions.explanation: Timothy is exhorted to lay hold on eternal life by fighting the good fight of faith.

questions.question: What title is given to God in 1 Timothy 6:15?
options: The blessed and only Potentate, King of kings, and Lord of lords
questions.correctAnswer: The blessed and only Potentate, King of kings, and Lord of lords
questions.explanation: This title expresses God's supreme authority and glory.

questions.question: According to 1 Timothy 6:17, in whom should the rich trust?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs the rich not to be highminded but to trust in the living God.

questions.question: What should the rich do according to 1 Timothy 6:18?
options: Do good, be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate
questions.correctAnswer: Do good, be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate
questions.explanation: Paul encourages rich believers to be generous and good workers.

questions.question: In 1 Timothy 6:20, what is Timothy warned to avoid?
options: Profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called
questions.correctAnswer: Profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called
questions.explanation: Timothy is warned to avoid false knowledge and foolish arguments.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Timothy 2:4, God desires all men to be saved and come to the knowledge of the truth.
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states God's desire for all to be saved.

questions.question: True or False: Paul tells Timothy in 1 Timothy 4:3 that forbidding marriage is a doctrine of devils.
questions.explanation: Such forbidding is linked to doctrines of devils in the text.

questions.question: True or False: In 1 Timothy 3:6, it is acceptable for a novice to be appointed as a bishop.
questions.explanation: Paul warns against appointing novices to avoid pride and falling into the devil's condemnation.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Timothy 1:15, Jesus Christ came into the world to save the righteous.
questions.explanation: The verse states Christ came to save sinners, of whom Paul was chief.

questions.question: True or False: In 1 Timothy 5:5, a widow who is solitary and trusts in God is described as blessed.
questions.explanation: The verse affirms the blessedness of such widows.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Timothy 6:7 teaches that we can carry our wealth with us when we die.
questions.explanation: The verse says we brought nothing into this world and can carry nothing out.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Timothy 3:11, the wives of deacons must be grave, not slanderers, sober, and faithful in all things.
questions.explanation: Paul sets these qualifications for the wives of deacons.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Timothy 2:13 states that Eve was formed before Adam.
questions.explanation: Adam was first formed, then Eve, according to this verse.

questions.question: True or False: In 1 Timothy 6:5, disputes and strifes of words come from men of corrupt minds and destitute of the truth.
questions.explanation: The verse describes such men as causing envy, strife, and railings.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Timothy 6:16 describes God as dwelling in darkness that no man can approach.
questions.explanation: God dwells in light which no man can approach unto.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Now the end of the commandment is ______ out of a pure heart...' (1 Timothy 1:5)
questions.explanation: The verse states the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For there is one God, and one ______ between God and men...' (1 Timothy 2:5)
questions.explanation: Christ Jesus is the one mediator between God and men.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'If a man desire the office of a ______, he desireth a good work.' (1 Timothy 3:1)
questions.explanation: The verse refers to the office of a bishop as a good work.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Let no man despise thy ______; but be thou an example of the believers...' (1 Timothy 4:12)
questions.explanation: Timothy is encouraged not to let anyone despise his youth.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain ______...' (1 Timothy 6:17)
questions.explanation: The rich are warned not to trust in uncertain riches but in God.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the laying on of the hands mentioned in 1 Timothy 4:14?
options: To impart a spiritual gift by prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: To impart a spiritual gift by prophecy
questions.explanation: The gift was given to Timothy by prophecy with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.

questions.question: Who are the two men mentioned in 1 Timothy 1:20 that Paul delivered unto Satan?
questions.explanation: These men were delivered unto Satan to learn not to blaspheme.
